required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

collaborator.agency: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)

brief_summary.textblock: The RECESS study will compare the effects of transfusing red blood cell units stored <= 10 days vs. red blood cell units stored >= 21 days, in patients who are undergoing complex cardiac surgery and are likely to need a red blood cell transfusion. The primary hypothesis is that there is a clinically important difference between the effects of shorter-storage red cell units and longer-storage red cell units on clinical outcomes and mortality risk.

primary_outcome.measure: The Change in the Composite Multiple Organ Dysfunction Score (MODS) From the Pre-operative Baseline. The Worst Post-operative Values of Each Component of MODS Will be Used to Calculate the Change in MODS.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Through post-operative day 7, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurs first
primary_outcome.description: The follow-up MODS used to calculate 7-day ΔMODS from pre-op baseline was based on the worst value of each component of MODS observed through post-op day 7, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurred first, even if a subject's worst values for different components occurred on different dates. Subjects who died during this time period were assigned the worst possible follow-up MODS score, 24 points, and each component of MODS was set at 4, which is the worst score. If a subject did not die during this time period but had at least one day where the Glasgow Coma Score couldn't be scored [subject sedated; neurologic function not normal by pre-op history (prior stroke, tumor or trauma sequelae, cognitively challenged, behavioral disorder, etc.) or intra-op history, but currently unable to assess because of sedation], then a post-op MODS score was set to missing and a 7-day ΔMODS was not computed. The total MODS score ranges from 0 (best possible) to 24 points (worst possible).

secondary_outcome.description: Subjects were randomized for RECESS no earlier than one calendar day before the planned date of surgery, and were followed for all-cause mortality until post-operative Day 28, death, or study withdrawal, whichever occurred first. In some cases the surgery was postponed after randomization had already occurred. If surgery did not occur within 30 days after randomization, the subject ended the study and was not considered evaluable. If surgery did occur within 30 days after randomization, and the subject received at least one RBC transfusion between randomization and 96 hours after the end of surgery, the subject was considered evaluable. Therefore, in a few evaluable subjects, post-operative Day 28 could be nearly two months after the date of randomization. The times in the time-to-event analysis started at randomization.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Multiple Organ Dysfunction Score From Pre-operative Baseline.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through 28 days post-surgery, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurs first
secondary_outcome.description: The follow-up MODS used to calculate 28-day ΔMODS from pre-op baseline was based on the worst value of each component of MODS observed through post-op day 28, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurred first, even if a subject's worst values for different components occurred on different dates. Subjects who died during this time period were assigned the worst possible follow-up MODS score, 24 points, and each component of MODS was set at 4, which is the worst score. If a subject did not die during this time period but had at least one day where the Glasgow Coma Score couldn't be scored[subject sedated; neurologic function not normal by pre-op history (prior stroke, tumor or trauma sequelae, cognitively challenged, behavioral disorder, etc.) or intra-op history, but currently unable to assess because of sedation], then a post-op MODS score was set to missing and a 28-day ΔMODS was not computed. The total MODS score ranges from 0 (best possible) to 24 points (worst possible).

secondary_outcome.measure: Composite of Major In-hospital Post-operative Complications (Death, Stroke, Myocardial Infarction, Renal Failure, Culture-proven Sepsis/Septic Shock)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through post-operative day 7, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurs first

secondary_outcome.measure: Composite of Major Cardiac Events (Death, Myocardial Infarction, Low Cardiac Output, Ventricular Tachycardia, Ventricular Fibrillation)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through post-operative day 7, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurs first

secondary_outcome.measure: Composite of Major Pulmonary Events (Any Mechanical Ventilation From 48 Hours Post-operation to Day 7, Hospital Discharge or Death, Whichever Comes First, or Pulmonary Embolism)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through post-operative day 7, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurs first
Through post-operative day 28, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurs first
secondary_outcome.description: Because some subjects may experience multiple periods of ventilator use, the total duration that they were on a ventilator was compared between the two groups.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Serum Creatinine From Pre-operative Value to Worst Post-operative Value
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through post-operative day 7, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurs first

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Troponin-I From Pre-operative Value to Worst Post-operative Value
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through post-operative day 7, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurs first

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Lactate From Pre-operative Value to Worst Post-operative Value
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through post-operative day 7, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurs first
secondary_outcome.description: The arterial lactate levels were adjusted to make them comparable to venous lactate levels.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Bilirubin From Pre-operative Value to Worst Post-operative Value
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through post-operative day 7, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurs first

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in ALT From Pre-operative Value to Worst Post-operative Value (for Pediatric Subjects Only)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through post-operative day 7, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurs first
Through post-operative day 28, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurs first
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects were randomized for RECESS no earlier than one calendar day before the planned date of surgery, and were followed until post-operative Day 28, death, or study withdrawal, whichever occurred first. In some cases the surgery was postponed after randomization had already occurred. If surgery did not occur within 30 days after randomization, the subject ended the study and was not considered evaluable. If surgery did occur within 30 days after randomization, and the subject received at least one RBC transfusion between randomization and 96 hours after the end of surgery, the subject was considered evaluable. Therefore, in a few evaluable subjects, post-operative Day 28 could be nearly two months after the date of randomization. The times in the time-to-event analyses are from randomization to first post-operative bowel movement.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Through post-operative day 28, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurs first
secondary_outcome.description: Subjects were randomized for RECESS no earlier than one calendar day before the planned date of surgery, and were followed until post-operative Day 28, death, or study withdrawal, whichever occurred first. In some cases the surgery was postponed after randomization had already occurred. If surgery did not occur within 30 days after randomization, the subject ended the study and was not considered evaluable. If surgery did occur within 30 days after randomization, and the subject received at least one RBC transfusion between randomization and 96 hours after the end of surgery, the subject was considered evaluable. Therefore, in a few evaluable subjects, post-operative Day 28 could be nearly two months after the date of randomization. The times in the time-to-event analyses are from randomization to first post-operative solid food.

secondary_outcome.measure: Days Alive and Ventilator Free Through Post-op Day 28
Any Mechanical Ventilation More Than 48 Hours Post-operation
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 48 hours post-operation through day 28, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurs first

arm_group.description: Red blood cell units stored <= 10 days
Red blood cell units stored >= 21 days

intervention.intervention_name: Red blood cell units stored <= 10 days
intervention.description: Pre-storage leukoreduced red blood cell units stored <=10 days at time of transfusion. Can be AS1, AS3, or AS5. Frozen, deglycerolized, washed, and volume-reduced products are protocol violations.

intervention.intervention_name: Red blood cell units stored >= 21 days
intervention.description: Pre-storage leukoreduced red blood cell units stored >=21 days at time of transfusion. Can be AS1, AS3, or AS5. Frozen, deglycerolized, washed, and volume-reduced products are protocol violations.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- >= 12 years old
- >= 40 kg body weight
- Scheduled complex cardiac surgery with planned use of median sternotomy.
- Patients ≥ 18 years must have a Transfusion Risk Understanding Scoring Tool (TRUST) probability score ≥ 3
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal of blood products
- Planned surgery is minimally invasive
- Known transfusion reaction history
- Requirement for washed products, volume reduced products, or products with additive solution removed
- Expected residual cyanosis with O2 saturation < 90
- Left ventricular assist device (LVAD) or Extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO) support pre-operatively or planned need post-operatively
- Cardiogenic shock requiring pre-operative placement of an Intra-aortic balloon pump (IABP) (IABP done for unstable angina or prophylactically for low ejection fraction is not excluded)
- Planned Deep Hypothermic Circulatory Arrest (DHCA)
- Renal dysfunction requiring pre-operative renal replacement therapies such as hemodialysis (HD) or continuous venovenous hemofiltration (CVVH)
- Planned use of alternative to heparin, e.g. bivalirudin
- Planned use of autologous or directed donations
- Prior RBC transfusion during hospitalization for the study-qualifying surgery
- Prior randomization into the RECESS study

participant_flow.recruitment_details: RECESS recruitment took place at 33 US hospitals, beginning in January 2010 and ending in January 2014.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Randomization was stratified by age (≥18 yrs or <18 yrs) and by whether or not the subject was in the ICU prior to surgery. A subject could not be randomized unless prior to surgery but no earlier than one calendar day prior to surgery, the transfusion service had enough suitable units of both storage durations to satisfy the cross-match request.

group.title: Shorter-storage Red Blood Cell Units
group.description: Red blood cell units stored <= 10 days Red blood cell units stored <= 10 days: Pre-storage leukoreduced red blood cell units stored <=10 days at time of transfusion. Can be AS1, AS3, or AS5. Frozen, deglycerolized, washed, and volume-reduced products are protocol violations.

group.title: Longer-storage Red Blood Cell Units
group.description: Red blood cell units stored >= 21 days Red blood cell units stored >= 21 days: Pre-storage leukoreduced red blood cell units stored >=21 days at time of transfusion. Can be AS1, AS3, or AS5. Frozen, deglycerolized, washed, and volume-reduced products are protocol violations.

drop_withdraw_reason.title: no surgery w/in 30 days of randomization

baseline.population: Analysis is restricted to evaluable subjects (defined as randomized subjects who underwent cardiac surgery within 30 days after randomization and received at least one RBC transfusion between randomization and post-operative hour 96).

group.title: Shorter-storage Red Blood Cell Units
group.description: Red blood cell units stored <= 10 days Red blood cell units stored <= 10 days: Pre-storage leukoreduced red blood cell units stored <=10 days at time of transfusion. Can be AS1, AS3, or AS5. Frozen, deglycerolized, washed, and volume-reduced products are protocol violations.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

class.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

measure.title: Minimum TRUST Score
measure.description: Per Alghamdi et al article in Transfusion (2006), the Transfusion Risk Understanding Scoring Tool (TRUST) score is an additive algorithm that provides an overall score that ranges from 0 to 8. The interpretation of the total score as it relates to the probability of exposure to transfusion is as follows: 0=baseline risk; 1=low risk; 2=intermediate risk; 3=high risk; 4-8=very high risk.

measure.title: Baseline Multiple Organ Dysfunction Score
measure.description: Per Marshall et al article in Critical Care Medicine (1995), increasing Multiple Organ Dysfunction Scores correlated with in-hospital mortality. No deaths occurred in patients with a MODS score of 0. The approximate in-hospital mortality rates were 6% for patients with MODS score of 1-4 points, 15% for patients with scores between 5-8, 50% for patients with scores between 8-12, 68% for patients with scores 13-16, 80% for patients with scores 17-20 and 100% for scores > 20.

outcome.title: The Change in the Composite Multiple Organ Dysfunction Score (MODS) From the Pre-operative Baseline. The Worst Post-operative Values of Each Component of MODS Will be Used to Calculate the Change in MODS.
outcome.description: The follow-up MODS used to calculate 7-day ΔMODS from pre-op baseline was based on the worst value of each component of MODS observed through post-op day 7, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurred first, even if a subject’s worst values for different components occurred on different dates. Subjects who died during this time period were assigned the worst possible follow-up MODS score, 24 points, and each component of MODS was set at 4, which is the worst score. If a subject did not die during this time period but had at least one day where the Glasgow Coma Score couldn't be scored [subject sedated; neurologic function not normal by pre-op history (prior stroke, tumor or trauma sequelae, cognitively challenged, behavioral disorder, etc.) or intra-op history, but currently unable to assess because of sedation], then a post-op MODS score was set to missing and a 7-day ΔMODS was not computed. The total MODS score ranges from 0 (best possible) to 24 points (worst possible).
outcome.time_frame: Through post-operative day 7, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurs first
outcome.population: Analysis is restricted to evaluable subjects (defined as randomized subjects who underwent cardiac surgery within 30 days after randomization and received at least one RBC transfusion between randomization and post-operative hour 96).

measure.title: The Change in the Composite Multiple Organ Dysfunction Score (MODS) From the Pre-operative Baseline. The Worst Post-operative Values of Each Component of MODS Will be Used to Calculate the Change in MODS.
measure.description: The follow-up MODS used to calculate 7-day ΔMODS from pre-op baseline was based on the worst value of each component of MODS observed through post-op day 7, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurred first, even if a subject’s worst values for different components occurred on different dates. Subjects who died during this time period were assigned the worst possible follow-up MODS score, 24 points, and each component of MODS was set at 4, which is the worst score. If a subject did not die during this time period but had at least one day where the Glasgow Coma Score couldn't be scored [subject sedated; neurologic function not normal by pre-op history (prior stroke, tumor or trauma sequelae, cognitively challenged, behavioral disorder, etc.) or intra-op history, but currently unable to assess because of sedation], then a post-op MODS score was set to missing and a 7-day ΔMODS was not computed. The total MODS score ranges from 0 (best possible) to 24 points (worst possible).
measure.population: Analysis is restricted to evaluable subjects (defined as randomized subjects who underwent cardiac surgery within 30 days after randomization and received at least one RBC transfusion between randomization and post-operative hour 96).

analysis.method_desc: The treatment groups were compared with respect to the change in MODS, adjusting for baseline MODS.
analysis.estimate_desc: The longer storage red blood cell units arm is the reference category. After adjusting for baseline MODS, the difference in the means was -0.17, positive values are in favor of longer storage duration.

analysis.estimate_desc: The longer storage red blood cell units arm is the reference category. After adjusting for baseline MODS, the difference in the means was -0.32; positive values are in favor of longer storage duration.

analysis.estimate_desc: The difference in proportions between the two treatment arms was computed as the proportion of subjects with the event in the shorter storage duration arm minus the proportion of subjects with the event in the longer storage duration arm.

group.description: Red blood cell units stored >= 21 days Red blood cell units stored >= 21 days: Pre-storage leukoreduced red blood cell units stored >=21 days at time of transfusion. Can be AS1, AS3, or AS5. Frozen, deglycerolized, washed, and volume-reduced products are protocol violations.

measure.title: Change in Troponin-I From Pre-operative Value to Worst Post-operative Value
measure.population: Analysis is restricted to evaluable subjects (defined as randomized subjects who underwent cardiac surgery within 30 days after randomization and received at least one RBC transfusion between randomization and post-operative hour 96).

analysis.groups_desc: Troponin-I values recorded as 'too low to detect' were recoded as 0 since the median value of the minimum quantitative troponin-I value obtained among all participating sites was 0.01.
analysis.p_value_desc: The treatment arms were compared with respect to the change in troponin-I, adjusting for the baseline troponin-I value.
analysis.estimate_desc: The longer storage red blood cell units arm is the reference category. After adjusting for baseline troponin-I, the change in troponin-I values was 1.9 ng/mL higher in the shorter storage red blood cell units arm.

outcome.title: Change in Lactate From Pre-operative Value to Worst Post-operative Value
outcome.description: The arterial lactate levels were adjusted to make them comparable to venous lactate levels.
outcome.time_frame: Through post-operative day 7, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurs first
outcome.population: Analysis is restricted to evaluable subjects (defined as randomized subjects who underwent cardiac surgery within 30 days after randomization and received at least one RBC transfusion between randomization and post-operative hour 96).

measure.title: Change in Bilirubin From Pre-operative Value to Worst Post-operative Value
measure.population: Analysis is restricted to evaluable subjects (defined as randomized subjects who underwent cardiac surgery within 30 days after randomization and received at least one RBC transfusion between randomization and post-operative hour 96).

analysis.estimate_desc: The longer storage red blood cell units arm is the reference category. After adjusting for baseline bilirubin, the change in bilirubin values was 0.65 mg/dL lower in the shorter storage red blood cell units arm.

outcome.title: Change in ALT From Pre-operative Value to Worst Post-operative Value (for Pediatric Subjects Only)
outcome.time_frame: Through post-operative day 7, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurs first
outcome.population: Only 4 pediatric subjects were enrolled. One treatment arm had only one subject with available data for analyzing the change in ALT. Therefore, to protect patient confidentiality, results were not entered.

group.title: Shorter-storage Red Blood Cell Units
group.description: Red blood cell units stored <= 10 days Red blood cell units stored <= 10 days: Pre-storage leukoreduced red blood cell units stored <=10 days at time of transfusion. Can be AS1, AS3, or AS5. Frozen, deglycerolized, washed, and volume-reduced products are protocol violations.

group.description: Red blood cell units stored >= 21 days Red blood cell units stored >= 21 days: Pre-storage leukoreduced red blood cell units stored >=21 days at time of transfusion. Can be AS1, AS3, or AS5. Frozen, deglycerolized, washed, and volume-reduced products are protocol violations.

measure.title: Change in ALT From Pre-operative Value to Worst Post-operative Value (for Pediatric Subjects Only)
measure.population: Only 4 pediatric subjects were enrolled. One treatment arm had only one subject with available data for analyzing the change in ALT. Therefore, to protect patient confidentiality, results were not entered.

outcome.title: Days to First Bowel Movement
outcome.description: Subjects were randomized for RECESS no earlier than one calendar day before the planned date of surgery, and were followed until post-operative Day 28, death, or study withdrawal, whichever occurred first. In some cases the surgery was postponed after randomization had already occurred. If surgery did not occur within 30 days after randomization, the subject ended the study and was not considered evaluable. If surgery did occur within 30 days after randomization, and the subject received at least one RBC transfusion between randomization and 96 hours after the end of surgery, the subject was considered evaluable. Therefore, in a few evaluable subjects, post-operative Day 28 could be nearly two months after the date of randomization. The times in the time-to-event analyses are from randomization to first post-operative bowel movement.
outcome.time_frame: Through post-operative day 28, hospital discharge, or death, whichever occurs first
outcome.population: Analysis is restricted to evaluable subjects (defined as randomized subjects who underwent cardiac surgery within 30 days after randomization and received at least one RBC transfusion between randomization and post-operative hour 96). The mean time to an event is estimated by the area under the survival function.

group.title: Shorter-storage Red Blood Cell Units

measure.population: Analysis is restricted to evaluable subjects (defined as randomized subjects who underwent cardiac surgery within 30 days after randomization and received at least one RBC transfusion between randomization and post-operative hour 96).

analysis.estimate_desc: The difference in proportions between the two treatment arms was computed as the proportion of subjects with the event in the shorter storage duration arm minus the proportion of subjects with the event in the longer storage duration arm.

reported_events.time_frame: Reported Adverse Events (AEs) include any untoward medical occurrence which occurred after a subject gave informed consent and no later than post-operative day 28, hospital discharge, or death, whichever came first.
reported_events.desc: Data were collected on all serious adverse events (SAEs) and on pre-specified types of non-serious adverse events. If a subject experiences more than one occurrence of a specific adverse event, the subject was counted only once for that adverse event.

group.title: Shorter-storage Red Blood Cell Units
group.description: Red blood cell units stored <= 10 days Red blood cell units stored <= 10 days: Pre-storage leukoreduced red blood cell units stored <=10 days at time of transfusion. Can be AS1, AS3, or AS5. Frozen, deglycerolized, washed, and volume-reduced products are protocol violations.

event.sub_title: Differential white blood cell count normal

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Only 4 pediatric subjects were enrolled. One treatment arm had only one subject with available data for analyzing the change in ALT outcome. Therefore, to protect patient confidentiality, results were not entered for this outcome.
